disclaimerData.disclaimer:
PATIENT AGREEMENT: This form aims to inform you about the potential benefits and risks of laser treatment for ingrown hair reduction. Please read this information attentively and discuss any questions fully with your provider before proceeding.

You should take the necessary time to consider this treatment carefully, weighing all your alternatives before making an informed decision. It is essential that you know you have the right to seek a second opinion, and you are encouraged to ask any questions that occur to you at any stage of the process.

Laser ingrown hair reduction employs targeted light energy to destroy hair follicles that are prone to producing ingrown hairs, preventing hairs from regrowing and curling back into the skin. Effective for areas such as the bikini line, legs, face, and beard where pseudofolliculitis (razor bumps) or ingrown hairs frequently occur. Multiple sessions (6-8) are needed as the laser targets follicles in the active growth phase; this reduces both existing inflammation and future occurrences.

Most effective for coarse or curly dark hair; studies indicate approximately 75% significant reduction after 3 sessions. No guarantees can be given as hormonal factors and skin type affect outcomes. Skin sensitivity may persist for up to 14 days post-treatment; avoid shaving between sessions.

I will be informed of each session's practitioner and location. I may withdraw my consent at any time.

RISKS AND POSSIBLE REACTIONS: Common: temporary redness, swelling, mild discomfort, heightened sensitivity to sunlight for up to 14 days. Existing ingrown hairs may shed during treatment.

Less common: blistering, crusting, temporary pigment changes (higher risk in treated areas with ingrowns), folliculitis flare-up.

Rare: burns, scarring, infection, paradoxical hypertrichosis (increased hair growth). Allergic reactions to topical agents are possible.

I understand risks from both known and unknown causes and I accept them. I have disclosed my full history of reactions to shaving or waxing.

I confirm I have been provided with advice regarding the reasons for treatment, risks (general and personal), benefits, alternatives including no treatment, uncertainties, probability of success (up to 90% reduction), and follow-up care.

MEDICAL IMAGERY: I authorize clinical photographs and videos to be taken for my confidential medical records.

I have discussed my objectives; all my questions have been answered to my satisfaction. No new information influences my decision. I consent to this procedure. This document supersedes any previous information.

questions.content: Do you understand the information that has been provided to you?
Do you feel enough information has been shared for you to give informed consent?
Have you given your consent willingly and without pressure?
Do you have any current health conditions?
Are you pregnant or breastfeeding at present?
Do you have a neuromuscular disorder (for example, Multiple Sclerosis, ALS, motor neuropathy, myasthenia gravis, or Lambert-Eaton syndrome)?
Do you have an autoimmune disease?
Do you currently have any skin concerns?
Do you have any known allergies or a history of severe allergic reactions (anaphylaxis)?
Is there an active infection in the area where the treatment is planned?
Are you currently taking any antibiotics or other prescription medications?
Is there any other Medical or Social History we should be aware of? If yes, please explain in full detail.
What are your aims and what results are you hoping to achieve from this procedure? Please elaborate.
Have you had this or a similar treatment before? If so, were there any complications? Please provide details.
Do you have any worries or concerns? If so, please describe them.
Is there any other information we need to know? Please provide a comprehensive account.
I will retain this information during my treatment period and refer to it as necessary.
